titleStmt.title: Walter Scott to James W. Tate
CWG8049

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Nashville Tenn
Aug 11th 1863.
Hon Jas W. Tate
Asst Secy State
Frankfort
Ky
Sir --

Enclosed please find my affadavit an oath of Office taken before an authorized Notary Public. If any thing else is required please notify me. And will be duly attended to. I suppose you received your fee from me at Louisville never having received a letter in response I did not know wether you had received it or not. As I left orders to have it sent to you immediately with letter of explanation.

Please acknowledge receipt of this
And oblige
Your Obdt Sevt
Walter Scott

Tennessee
Oath of W. Scott
Comr of Deeds
Filed Aug 14. 1863
